enWisdom: Being compassionate to the weak brings down [divine] mercy

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَرْجُو رَحْمَةَ مَنْ فَوْقَهُ كَيْفَ لَا يَرْحَمُ مَنْ دُونَهُ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who hopes for the mercy of one who is above him, how can he not show compassion to the one who is below him?!
One who shows no mercy will be shown no mercy

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَرْحَمِ النَّاسَ مَنَعَهُ اللَّهُ رَحْمَتَهُ
enWisdom: One who shows no mercy to the people, Allah will withhold His mercy from him
One who shows mercy is shown mercy
Just as you show mercy, mercy will be shown to you

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ تَسْكُنِ الرَّحْمَةُ قَلْبَهُ قَلَّ لِقَاؤُهَا لَهُ عِنْدَ حَاجَتِهِ
enWisdom: One in whose heart there exists no mercy, meets less of it [mercy] when he needs it
It is by the honourable that mercy is shown

Wisdom: مِنْ أَوْكَدِ أَسْبَابِ الْعَقْلِ رَحْمَةُ الْجُهَّالِ [الْجَاهِلِ‏]
enWisdom: One of the surest means of intelligence is showing mercy to the ignorant
The most deserving of [showing] mercy is the one who [himself] is in need of it

Wisdom: أَحَقُّ النَّاسِ بِالرَّحْمَةِ عَالِمٌ يَجْرِي عَلَيْهِ حُكْمُ جَاهِلٍ وَكَرِيمٌ يَسْتَوْلِي عَلَيْهِ لَئِيمٌ وَبَرٌّ تَسَلَّطَ عَلَيْهِ فَاجِرٌ
enWisdom: Of all the people, the most deserving of compassion are: the scholar upon whom an ignorant person passes judgment, the noble person who is dominated by a vile person and the virtuous person who is under the command of a vicious person

Wisdom: أَبْلَغُ مَا تُسْتَدَرُّ بِهِ الرَّحْمَةُ أَنْ تُضْمَرَ لِجَمِيعِ النَّاسِ الرَّحْمَةُ
enWisdom: The most effective thing in making mercy flow forth [and surround you] is having mercy in your heart for all the people
